title: Historical Periods in American Development

vocab.definition: A settlement controlled by another country
Freedom from being controlled by another country
Growing larger by adding new territory
A person who moves to a new area to settle there
The time when machines began to do work that people used to do by hand

teachingNotes: Cover major periods: Colonial times, Independence, Westward Expansion, and Industrial Revolution. Use timelines and maps to show how America grew and changed. Connect to local history when possible.

sample.question: What major change happened during the Industrial Revolution?
What were the 13 original colonies part of before independence?
Who were pioneers?
expectedAny: people who moved west to settle new land

sample.question: What is westward expansion?
expectedAny: moving west to add new territory

sample.question: Name one new technology from the Industrial Revolution.

truefalse.question: The 13 original colonies were controlled by Great Britain.
The Industrial Revolution increased factory work.
Westward expansion made the country smaller.
The transcontinental railroad helped connect the East and West.
Independence means being ruled by another country.
New inventions changed how people lived and worked.
